title: How to Reset Service Lights BMW X5 or X6 (E70 or E71)

steps.title: Insert your remote key into the key slot.
steps.content: Insert your remote key into the key slot. Next, press the 'Start Stop' button once without putting your foot on the brake. You should see numerous lights turn on in the dash. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press the ‘BC’ button if necessary.
steps.content: Press the ‘BC’ button if necessary. In some cases, such as a low fuel warning light, you may need to press the ‘BC’ button to remove them. This button is located on the end of the indicator stalk. Otherwise, the lights should go out on their own.

steps.title: Locate the button on the bottom left of the speedometer (instrument cluster).
steps.content: Locate the button on the bottom left of the speedometer (instrument cluster). As you press and hold the button, an exclamation mark will appear in the screen in the middle of the speedometer. Keep holding down the button until the next picture appears, then let go.

steps.title: Let go when you find the service you want.
steps.content: Let go when you find the service you want. One by one, go through all of the picture options for each service. When you arrive at the service that you wish to reset, press and hold the black button until the text 'Reset?' is visible under the picture, then let go. Finally, press and hold the button again to confirm the reset.

steps.title: Confirm your selection by long pressing the button.
steps.content: Confirm your selection by long pressing the button. Two service options which may be visible on your dash require resetting to a future date (statutory vehicle inspection and statutory exhaust gas inspection). This is done by pressing singularly to scroll though the numbers and then long pressing to confirm your selection. There have been some instances where statutory inspections will not reset. In Australia, neither of these services are required, and they can be removed at any BMW dealership. If you can't reset them manually, you'll have to visit the dealer. [2] X Research source
